Criteria.Name: Introduction Effectiveness
Criteria.Description: clarity and effectiveness in the introductory paragraph by presenting the essay's main argument or focus.

Criteria.Name: Thesis Statement Strength
Criteria.Description: precision, clarity, and relevance in the thesis statement, effectively guiding the essay.

Criteria.Name: Conclusion Quality
Criteria.Description: effectiveness in the conclusion by summarizing key points and reinforcing the thesis.

Criteria.Name: Depth of Analysis
Criteria.Description: depth and complexity in analyzing the topic or themes within the essay.

Criteria.Name: Understanding of Context
Criteria.Description: understanding of the historical, cultural, or social context related to the essay's topic.

Criteria.Name: Logical Flow
Criteria.Description: logical progression of ideas and arguments throughout the essay.

Criteria.Name: Paragraph Structure
Criteria.Description: coherence and clarity in individual paragraphs, with clear topic sentences and supporting details.

Criteria.Name: Transition Between Ideas
Criteria.Description: effectiveness in transitioning between ideas or paragraphs within the essay.

Criteria.Name: Originality of Thought
Criteria.Description: originality and creativity in their analysis or argument throughout the essay.

Criteria.Name: Use of Literary Devices
Criteria.Description: identification and discussion of literary devices such as symbolism, metaphors, or imagery.

Criteria.Name: Grammar and Syntax
Criteria.Description: use of grammar, punctuation, and sentence structure throughout the essay.

Criteria.Name: Adherence to Assignment Guidelines
Criteria.Description: adherence to the assignment's requirements, including length, topic, and formatting.

Criteria.Name: Cohesion of Argument
Criteria.Description: strength and consistency in the main argument across all sections of the essay.

Criteria.Name: Relevance of Evidence
Criteria.Description: relevance and appropriateness in the supporting evidence used to back up claims.

Criteria.Name: Critical Thinking
Criteria.Description: critical thinking skills in evaluating texts, arguments, or perspectives.

Criteria.Name: Depth of Research
Criteria.Description: quality and depth of research, using credible sources where applicable.

Criteria.Name: Word Choice
Criteria.Description: precision, sophistication, and appropriateness in their vocabulary use throughout the essay.

Criteria.Name: Persuasiveness
Criteria.Description: persuasiveness in convincing the reader of their argument or perspective.

Criteria.Name: Citation and Referencing
Criteria.Description: use of citation formats and accuracy in referencing sources (APA, MLA, etc.).

Criteria.Name: Engagement with Counterarguments
Criteria.Description: ability to acknowledge, engage with, and refute opposing viewpoints or counterarguments.
